item.title: China’s Olympic Pride (& Propaganda) / 1st Trip to China (22 Yrs Ago This Week) [China Compass]
item.description:
Welcome to the China Compass Podcast on the Fight Laugh Feast Network! I’m your host & China travel guide, missionary Ben. You can follow me on X (@chinaadventures), where I post daily details and reminders to pray for China (PrayforChina.us). You can also email me with any questions or comments @ bfwesten at gmail dot com, which is my pen name. If you want to learn more about our missions projects or get any one of my books, visit PrayGiveGo.us. 

 

This week, I'm trying to get back into my “normal” podcast schedule, as I comment on current events from a Chinese perspective, highlight one particular Chinese province to pray for, and then finish by telling a bunch of stories from my experiences in that particular province.

 

So we start by discussing China's Olympic pride and propaganda, dating back to the 2008 Beijing Olympics and turning to the current medal competition with the United States. Here are the NPR articles that I referenced...

https://www.npr.org/2024/08/09/nx-s1-5068021/olympic-medal-count-paris-gold-silver-bronze-total

https://www.npr.org/2024/08/02/nx-s1-5061584/china-paris-olympic-gold-medal-count

 

Next we look in depth at the Chinese province of Jiangxi, which is paired up with Georgia in our Pray for China prayer scheme (https://prayforchina.us/index.php/georgia/). Hot, humid, hilly, located in SE China and and only slightly larger than Georgia, Jiangxi was the early hideout (aka, Jiangxi Soviet) of the the Communist guerillas (led by Mao) in the 1920s and 30s, as well as home to the important Lushan Hill Station, which was built by missionaries in the late 19th Century, but served as a de facto southern capital for the Communist Part for many years during Mao's reign.

 

Finally, during story time I talk about turning 19 on the streets of Jiangxi's capital, Nanchang. I share about our encounters with police (and a sheep!) in Yiyang and Lianhua, getting taken for a (yummy) ride in Ji’an, oversleeping on a wooden bed, walking circles around Ganzhou, and wading through the Dingnan floods all while "running from the light".

 

As I mention on the podcast, get your copy of Borden of Yale (free on Kindle!), who visited northern Jiangxi in the fall of 1904 at the age of just 16, and tells a few stories himself: BordenofYale.com
item.author: FLF, LLC
item.itunes:author: FLF, LLC

item.title: What Do Concerns About Electoral and Legislative Outcomes Say About Us? [God, Law, and Liberty]
item.description: At a recent gathering of political and legal advocates from around the nation, most of whom were Christians, these questions were asked: “What keeps you up at night?” and “What is most urgent to you?” David uses an excerpt from C.S. Lewis’s The Weight of Glory, an excerpt from John Owen’s Christologia, and Hebrews Chapter 4, to provide insight into what the questions and the way they were framed says about our understanding of the Gospel.
item.author: FLF, LLC
item.itunes:author: FLF, LLC

item.title: Ep. 122: Making a Difference with Bunni Pounds [The Outstanding Podcast]
item.description:
It truly only takes one to make a difference. Host Joseph Backholm is joined by the president and founder of Christians Engaged, Bunni Pounds, for a conversation emphasizing the need and ability of believers to make an impact where they can! In a world that seems to turn upside down on a weekly basis, do not be disheartened or anxious about the news – YOU can do something. Bunni encourages listeners with practical steps on how to get involved in your little square of the world. Everyone was created to be disciple-makers. Listen now to learn how you can be on mission for the kingdom of Christ right here in America.

Read ⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠The Washington Stand⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠, featuring news and commentary from a biblical worldview. Published by ⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠Family Research Council⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠.

item.title: HELP! How Can I Fix Years of BAD HABITS?? [The Waterbreak]
item.description:
We’re responding to a great question that was sent in to us: “How can we start moving forward when we have years of bad habits?”

 

This is a great topic to talk about since SO MANY people are going through this very thing! If you have any other questions or thoughts that you’d like to share, reach out at RenchMedia@gmail.com

item.title: Feminism Has DESTROYED Females [Liberty Dispatch]
item.description:
Liberty Dispatch ~ August 08, 2024
In this episode of Liberty Dispatch, Andrew and Matty break down how the lying satanic roots of revolutionary spirit have not only affected the Olympic Opening Ceremony but have haunted the West for centuries and destroyed the very thing it seeks to save.

Segment 1 - News Brief:
"Majority of Canadians View Trudeau as 'Incompetent Liar': Poll" | The Post Millennial: https://thepostmillennial.com/majority-of-canadians-view-trudeau-as-incompetent-liar-poll;
"Canada's Emergency Room Crisis: Patients Facing Longer Waits" | National Post: https://nationalpost.com/news/canada/canada-emergency-room-crisis;
"Trans Person's Facial Feminization Surgery Will Not Be Covered by Ontario Health Plan" | The Post Millennial: https://thepostmillennial.com/trans-persons-facial-feminization-surgery-will-not-be-covered-by-ontario-health-plan?utm_content=;
"Ontario Ending Wastewater Surveillance Program Which Tracked COVID-19 Infection" | CTV News: https://toronto.ctvnews.ca/ontario-ending-wastewater-surveillance-program-which-tracked-covid-19-infection-1.6914415;
"2 Alberta Men Arrested for Threatening to Assassinate Trudeau, Freeland, Singh" | The Post Millennial: https://thepostmillennial.com/2-alberta-men-arrested-for-threatening-to-assassinate-trudeau-freeland-singh;

Segment 2:
"Protesters Not Guilty of Conspiring to Kill Mounties at Coutts Blockade" | Toronto Sun:
https://torontosun.com/news/crime/protesters-not-guilty-of-conspiring-to-kill-mounties-at-coutts-blockade;
"Morgan: The Kamloops Residential School Grave Story is a Hoax" | Western Standard:
https://www.westernstandard.news/opinion/morgan-the-kamloops-residential-school-grave-story-is-a-hoax/56507;
"Govt Corrupt's Tweet on Recent Events" | Twitter: https://x.com/govt_corrupt/status/1818656521464562008;

Segment 3:
Must Watch: Crosspolitic -The Paris Paganism & The French Revolution w/ Dr. George Grant: https://pubtv.flfnetwork.com/tabs/none/videos/32718;

"Lesbian in Center of Blasphemous Olympics Ceremony Says She Portrayed 'Olympic Jesus'" | LifeSiteNews:
https://www.lifesitenews.com/news/lesbian-in-center-of-blasphemous-olympics-ceremony-says-she-portrayed-olympic-jesus;
"Jordan Peterson Blasts Olympics for Fake Apology, Cover-Up, Lie About Blasphemous Opening Ceremony" | LifeSiteNews: https://www.lifesitenews.com/news/jordan-peterson-blasts-olympics-for-fake-apology-cover-up-lie-about-blasphemous-opening-ceremony;
"Boxer Imane Khelif Cleared to Compete in Olympics Despite Being Deemed Biologically Male, Leaves Italian Opponent in Tears as Fight is Abandoned" | Daily Mail: https://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-13697397/Boxer-Imane-Khelif-cleared-compete-Olympics-despite-deemed-biologically-male-leaves-Italian-opponent-tears-fight-abandoned.html;

"XY Athletes in Women's Olympic Boxing: Paris 2024 Controversy Explained" | Quillette: https://quillette.com/2024/08/03/xy-athletes-in-womens-olympic-boxing-paris-2024-controversy-explained-khelif-yu-ting 

CORRECTION: Matty mistakenly said the Olympic Finals of Female Boxing came down to a bout between Imane Khelif and a Chinese boxer. In fact, Khelif is faicng off against Taiwan's Lin Yu-ting.

item.title: Tell Better Stories ft. Ben Garrett [HOW TO WIN THE WORLD: Part 8]| Rebel - Podcast for Cultural Engagement [The Ezra Institute Podcast for Cultural Reformation]
item.description:
We have crossed over the mid-way point in this series “How to Win the World” after last week's mid-season review.

This week, P Nate is joined by Ben Garrett from Haunted Cosmos to discuss the theme of storytelling. Throughout Scripture, history is described as the unfolding drama of God's great narrative. How does understanding God's story properly and finding our place in it help to win the world? How does reading, loving, and writing stories help advance the Kingdom of God in history?

Join Ben and P Nate for some answers!

Episode Resources: Haunted Cosmos: https://www.youtube.com/@hauntedcosmos_; Haunted Cosmos Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/HauntedCosmos; Ben's X: https://x.com/tompawnbadil

item.title: The Three Stories To Survive An Apocalypse | Jason Farley [CrossPolitic Show]
item.description:
Description:

In this episode of the podcast, the hosts delve into the importance of storytelling and how it can shape our worldview and understanding of the world around us. They discuss the impact of narratives on our perception of current events, social media, and the news cycle. Special guest Jason Farley shares insights on the power of stories in challenging materialistic worldviews and nurturing faith. The conversation covers recommended books that offer unique perspectives on modernism, materialism, and the Christian worldview. From science fiction to classic literature, the hosts explore how these stories can help us navigate the complexities of life and society. Join the hosts as they discuss the relevance of storytelling in understanding the bigger narrative of life, repentance in America, and the need for unity within the church. Don't miss out on this thought-provoking and insightful episode!

Guests: Jason Farley

Key Topics: Importance of storytelling in shaping worldview Impact of narratives on perception of current events Recommended books challenging materialistic worldviews Nurturing faith through stories Repentance in America and the need for unity in the church

Don’t forget to Sign up for The FLF Conference 2024 (Prodigal America) https://flfnetwork.com/prodigal-america/

item.title: Jacob Tanner: Puritan Wisdom for Joyful Suffering [Dead Men Walking Podcast]
item.description:
This week Greg sat down with Jacob Tanner. Jacob is a Pastor, Co-Host of Eschatology Matters, and author of the new book "Wait and Hope: Puritan Wisdom for Joyful Suffering. (Get 15% off with the code "EMATTERS" at checkout) They discussed what joy during suffering looks like in practical application, what the puritan believed about suffering, how we deal with self inflicted trails, and how God's sovereignty plays a role. Enjoy!

item.title: TCND: Man with a Uterus (Shut Up, Conservatives) [The Comedian Next Door]
item.description:
Hey, Neighbor!  John has some things he wants to say--while the Peaches and the Pod Ninja ignore him...

Did you hear about the man (or is it a woman?) who failed the gender test in women's boxing? Did you know even CONSERVATIVES are struggling to understand what makes someone a woman?

Tune in for this biology-heavy lecture on female hormones, fertility cycles, and--oh yeah--all of our headphones are broken, so listen while we complain about that. 

Baby Bridger makes himself known a time or two as well.  It's a pretty typical Sunday at the Comedian's house!

Email the Comedian's family at nextdoor@johnbranyan.com.

item.title: Ep. 121: Religious Freedom Is Under Attack with Renee Carlson [The Outstanding Podcast]
item.description: Religious freedom is under attack in Minnesota. The general counsel of True North Legal, Renee Carlson, joins host Joseph Backholm to tell her story of how she and many others protected and reestablished religious freedom in Minnesota. The Minnesotan government is currently in complete control by the democratic party. Renee and colleagues noticed that the freedom of religion was essentially removed in recent MN state legislation. This change in legislation would not have only affected Christians, but Muslims, Jews, Mormons, and all other religions. By the grace of God, the freedom of religion was reestablished, but Renee warns everyone of faith to stay vigilant as this civil right is under attack. Listen now to hear her story and what are the biggest threats against people of faith!
item.author: Joseph Backholm
item.itunes:author: Joseph Backholm

item.title: Oxford Wrap Up [The Pugcast]
item.description:
On today's show the Pugs look back on their trip to Oxford and talk about some of the things they learned and enjoyed from the trip. Glenn leads off with three things he got a deeper appreciation for about C. S. Lewis, each of which brings in further discussion, ideas, and tangents from Chris and Tom. Throughout the conversation, all of the Pugs share experiences, ideas, and appreciation for Oxford and their time there.

 

Support the Pugcast on Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/thetheologypugcast?fbclid=IwAR17UHhfzjphO52C_kkZfursA_C784t0ldFix0wyB4fd-YOJpmOQ3dyqGf8

 

The Theology Pugcast is a ministry of Trinity Reformed Church in Huntsville Alabama. To view more media from TRC, visit their website: https://trinityreformedkirk.com/trc-media/

item.title: Glorifying God Through Great Art ft. Ryan Lauterio [Open Mike with Michael Thiessen]
item.description:
OPEN MIKE w/Michael Thiessen ~ August 03, 2024
On this episode of Open Mike, Dr. Thiessen is joined by Ryan Lauterio, founder of the Maker Institute, who discusses the importance of art in the Christian faith and the need for Christians to engage in the arts. He emphasizes that art is not neutral and can it be. It's either humanizing or dehumanizing in accord with the Word of God. Lauterio encourages Christians to be grateful for the arts and to push for excellence in their creative endeavors. He also addresses the false dilemma of quality versus budget, stating that Christians can make good art without needing a large budget. Lauterio calls for the church to take a vested interest in supporting and promoting Christian art.

item.title: China Missionary Killed in Plane Crash & 14 y/o Missionary Arrested in China [China Compass]
item.description:
I’m your host & China travel guide, missionary Ben. You can follow me on X @chinaadventures, and you can email me with any questions or comments @ bfwesten at gmail dot com. B.F. Westen is my pen name, btw.

If you want to learn more about our prayer and missionary projects and get any of the books I’ve helped to publish, check out the website www.PrayGiveGo.us for easy access to all of these things. 

On last week’s podcast I shared my extended interview with Evangelina, and her beautiful song reminding us to pray for the persecuted. This week’s podcast features a ½ hour interview with her brother “Jaime”, who talks in depth about his arrest and deportation from China in 2011, when he was just 14. 

Jaime is also one of the 10 being sentenced in Nashville. He, along with his sister and another young man, were sentenced on July 30th. Similarly to the other defendants (except for their dad, “Uncle Bundo”, who was given 6 months in jail), they were let off with a combination of home detention and probation. Here is the update that was posted online this week…

Update: The four defendants today have been given time served (which covers the 21 months of pretrial probation), followed by 90 days of home detention, followed by 3 years of probation.

But before my interview with Jaime, I spent some time remembering a brother, a friend, a missionary, who passed away in a plane crash in Canada (Merritt, BC) a few days ago (Sunday evening, July 27th), leaving behind a wife and five kids (from their late teens to mid 20s). For security reasons, I will just share his first name, Geoff. Listen to the podcast for my thoughts on his life and legacy.

item.title: Ep. 120: The Impact and Spread of the Transgender Ideology with Brandon Showalter [The Outstanding Podcast]
item.description:
When did it become medically ethical to remove healthy body parts? Host Joseph Backholm is joined by Christian Post journalist, Brand Showalter, for a conversation dissecting the transgender cult. Brandon has spent many years tracking the transgender movement and shares some of what he has learned from watching and researching the movement throughout the years. He sheds light on where in the social and political “life cycle” the trans movement is, do people actually believe in this, and how transgenderism came onto the social scene.

item.title: Megan Basham: "Shepherds For Sale", Andy Stanley, Keller and the Third Way [Let's Talk Eschatology]
item.description:
Megan Basham is a culture reporter for the Daily Wire and author of "Beside Every Successful Man: A Woman's Guide To Having It All. She is a frequent contributor to the Morning Wire, one of the top ten newscasts in the United States. She has also written for the Wall Street Journal, TheTelegraph, First Things, National Review, and World Magazine, where she worked as a film and television editor.

Megan's brand new book, Shepherd's For Sale, serves as a warning of what can happen when a church forgets that true power lies not in the world's wisdom, but in Scripture.

item.description:
Can you imagine what can be unburdened, by what has been? Well, the newly nominated Democratic presidential candidate can. Host Joseph Backholm is joined by Jonathan Keller, a resident Californian and president and CEO of California Family Council, as they unpack the question, “Who is Kamala Harris?”. How did she get her start? Jonathan gives an in-depth history of all the political positions she has previously held, her rise to political fame, and her current presidential campaign. Listen now to learn more about Kamala Harris and please try not to fall out of a coconut tree while you do.

item.title: TCND: Sweat and Being Counter-cultural (Pure Molten Happiness) [The Comedian Next Door]
item.description:
John is sweaty. Peaches is sweaty. But the baby doesn't mind...

Luke hurt his tongue...twice. And, eventually we get around to talking about being "counter-cultural." 

Viva la Revolucion! 

You can email the Comedian's family at Nextdoor@johnbranyan.com.

item.title: Oxford and Architecture [The Pugcast]
item.description:
After a week at Oxford, surrounded by some of the best buildings to be found anywhere in the world when it comes to higher education, the Pugs discuss architecture on today's brief episode. "Why does beauty matter?" and “Why are all the science buildings ugly?” are among a host of questions addressed. Tune in as the guys long for a world that builds things the way they used to.

 

Today’s episode is sponsored in part by David Stocker and SHM Architects: https://www.shmarchitects.com/

 

Support the Pugcast on Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/thetheologypugcast?fbclid=IwAR17UHhfzjphO52C_kkZfursA_C784t0ldFix0wyB4fd-YOJpmOQ3dyqGf8

 

The Theology Pugcast is a ministry of Trinity Reformed Church in Huntsville Alabama. To view more media from TRC, visit their website: https://trinityreformedkirk.com/trc-media/

item.title: The COVID Archives & the Church ft. Pastor Nathan Zekveld [Open Mike with Michael Thiessen]
item.description:
OPEN MIKE w/Michael Thiessen ~ July 27, 2024
On this episode of Open Mike, Dr. Thiessen talks to Pastor Nathan Zekveld about his NEW book The Covid Archives.  They discuss various topics related to COVID and its impact on society, the importance of remembering history, the concept of Christian witness, and the silencing of dissenting voices during the COVID-19 pandemic. They also talk about the role of experts and academia in shaping public opinion. Overall, the conversation emphasizes the need for critical thinking and the recognition of individual freedoms. The conversation explores the themes of Christian liberty, the divisiveness caused by mandatory vaccinations and lockdowns, the presence of pragmatism in the church, the rise of wokeness in Canada, and the need for reconciliation within congregations across Canada.

item.title: E** Faces Nashville Sentencing with Joyful China Memories and a Moving Song! [China Compass]
item.description:
On this special episode of the China Compass Podcast, Evangelina faces her upcoming Nashville sentencing (July 30, 2024) with faith and joy.

Then we talk through many happy (and scary) China memories, including her near escape (when I was deported).

Finally, she shares how my little deportation book (Unbeaten.vip), was a blessing to her (esp. the Appendix: Remember My Chains), then plays and sings the beautiful and powerful song, Remember Me.

She wrote this song about interceding for the persecuted partly based on my message, and partly from her own experience in US Prisons. 

As always, the China Compass Podcast is brought to you by www.PrayforChina.us!
item.author: FLF, LLC
item.itunes:author: FLF, LLC

item.title: 32. Praying The Imprecatory Psalms: Christians Should Hate Their Enemies AND Love Their Enemies [Reformation Red Pill]
item.description:
https://www.patreon.com/ReformationRedPill

Should Christians hate their enemies? Can we pray like David prays in the imprecatory psalms? On this week’s episode of The Reformation Red Pill Podcast Joshua Haymes, Brooks Potteiger, and Rich Lusk react to Pastor Joel Webbon’s comments at the New Christendom Press Conference. He said that he wanted to “crush his enemies & reward his friends.” On this episode, we will explore whether or not the Christian has Biblical precedence to use language like this by exploring the imprecatory psalms.

Our Wonderful Christian Business Sponsors: Private Family Banking Contact a Private Family Banking professional via email at banking@privatefamilybanking.com or call them directly at 830-339-9472.

For a Free E-book entitled "Protect Your Money Now! How to Build Multi-Generational Wealth Outside of Wall Street and Avoid the Coming Banking Meltdown" go to https://www.protectyourmoneynow.net and enter your email.

Squirrelly Joes Coffee Head over to squirrellyjoes.com/redpill to claim your free bag of coffee.

item.description:
8 Years Ago, CrossPolitic made its internet debut with this interview of Ted Cruz, occurring right in the midst of his campaign for president. In this interview, we push hard to get to the center of his views on abortion.

item.title: S1E16 - ¿Cómo crecer tu fe? [Madurando en Cristo]
item.description:
Descubre las tres claves fundamentales para cultivar una fe robusta y vibrante.

🔥 Aprende cómo sumergirte en la Palabra de Dios (Romanos 10:17)

🔥 Practicar la oración persistente (Lucas 18:1)

🔥 Poner tu fe en acción a través del servicio (Santiago 2:17)

✏️ Explora estrategias prácticas para fortalecer tu relación con Dios y transformar tu vida espiritual. ¡Crece en tu fe y vive una vida que glorifique a Dios!

Para leer el artículo de este programa: MadurandoEnCristo.org

item.title: How Do Christians Build in Crazy Times?? W/ Story Real Estate [CrossPolitic Show]
item.description:
How do christians build when the times are crazy and everyone is in a frenzy? Should Christians be buying houses now? Or should they wait for more peaceful times? 

Today the guys are joined by Chris and Jordan of Story Real estate to answer all these questions.
